ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments:
I learned how to allocate my time and not really stress myself out making sure to study every little thing every night, but still do well and learn the language. This skill will help me in all my other courses moving forward.
Specifically relating to the content of this course, I learned the basics of a whole language, which I am very proud of. I also learned a lot about roman life and how it different from our lives now, even though so many emotional experiences stayed the same.
Better understanding of Latin grammar, better ability to sight read and translate Latin texts
The course furthered my knowledge of Latin grammar, deepened my appreciation of the thematic concerns of major writers of the period, and familiarized with the nuances of style.
Review of Latin grammar, and read some good letters by Pliny.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
There were a lot of strengths to this course. It was fully engaging, and though demanding, it made to be as stress free as possible. I really enjoyed the content of the letters and poems and felt the layout of the class trying to decipher the sentences together was really enjoyable. It was very gratifying to be able to finally make sense of something I struggled with as homework. 
However, I think allocating some time every class to do a more thorough and structured review of grammatical concepts as they came up could have helped solidify things for me.
The course definitely achieves its goals, yet I believe it could be shortened to 2 hours per day, to avoid exhaustion.
Having an intermediate level would have been good, but the course was excellent.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would absolutely recommend this course to another student. Over the past ten weeks I have learned so much and even though to really learn the language and not skate by you need to put a lot of work in after class, the workload is complimented by the more laid back style of teaching.

I would highly recommend this course to another student. Professor Robinson is great and really cares about his students' learning. The readings done for class were very interesting and fun to read and translate!
I recommend this sequence to any student wishing to attain reading competence in Latin.
Yes, it is excellent for a relatively new Latin reader.

narratives.question_text: The Canvas course site allowed me to identify and access required course materials easily.
